data.title: University of Michigan Athletics
data.meta_description: Blake Frazier (77) OL - Prep • Attended Vandegrift High School (2024) coached by Drew Sanders • Helped the Vipers to a 10-1 record his senior year with a dis...
data.text:
Prep

• Attended Vandegrift High School (2024) coached by Drew Sanders

• Helped the Vipers to a 10-1 record his senior year with a district championship and state playoff appearance

• Reached the Texas Division II 6A state title game in 2022 with a 14-2 overall record

• Honorable Mention Academic All-State honoree as a senior

• Also lettered track and field, specializing in throws

Key Statistics

• His senior year, the offense averaged 41.2 points and 365.5 total yards per game, scoring 38-plus points in nine of 11 games

• Team-wide average of 4.9 yards per carry and 158.5 rushing yards per game with 26 rushing touchdowns

• As a junior in 2022, helped the offense average 36.7 points and 278.6 total yards per game, scoring 34-plus points in 10 of 16 games

• Blocked for a run game that scored 34 touchdowns with a team average of 4.8 yards per carry in his junior season

Honors and Rankings

• Earned a 247Sports Composite ranking of four stars; the No. 159 overall player nationally, the No. 13 tackle overall, and the No. 27 player in Texas

• Named a four-star prospect by 247Sports; the No. 208 overall player in the nation, the No. 19 tackle nationally, and the No. 35 player in Texas

• Rated as a four-star prospect by ESPN, the No. 290 overall player in the country, the No. 54 player in the region, the No. 26 tackle nationally, and the No. 46 player in Texas

• Rivals.com four-star prospect, the No. 82 player in the country, the No. 6 tackle nationally, and the No. 13 player in Texas

• On3.com four-star consensus prospect, the No. 161 player in the country, the No. 12 tackle overall, and the No. 28 player in Texas

• On3.com four-star prospect, the No. 195 player in the country, the No. 16 tackle nationally, and the No. 37 player in Texas

• Prepstar ranking of four stars, the No. 164 player in the country, the No. 16 tackle overall, and the No. 27 player in the state of Texas

• Prepstar Top 300 All-American

• Selected as the unanimous 2023 25-6A All-District Offensive Lineman of the Year

• Named to the 2023 Dave Campbell’s Texas Football Whataburger Super Team ballot

Personal

• Blake Frazier was born on December 20, 2005

• Son of Steve and Kim Frazier

• Father Steve was an Offensive Lineman for the Wolverines and was a member of the 1997 National Championship Team
